intro: Secamone angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf secamone, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent corona, which is a unique feature of the Apocynaceae family. It is often found in woodland and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
